predicate.note: Frames file for 'follow' based on survey of initial sentences of big corpus

roleset.name: be subsequent, temporally or spatially

example.name: transitive
example.text: The strong growth followed year-to-year increases of 21% in August.

example.name: passivized
example.text: California led the nation, followed by Texas, Iowa, and Florida

example.name: as temporal
example.text: Following the acquisition of RP Scherer, the maker of gelcaps decided to ...

roleset.note: the Arg1 would be the rest of the sentence, but we'll skip it. This construction happens a lot--occasionally there's a clear Arg1,--but usually not. Err on the side of caution when looking for an Arg1.

example.name: with causal agent
example.text: Mr. Simmons has followed friendly offers with a hostile tender offer.

roleset.name: adhere to, accept, pursue

example.name: another transitive

example.name: with manner
example.text: John avidly follows Major League baseball for his father, who can only receive Italian soccer on his TV.
